main_definition: A place where goods are manufactured or assembled, typically using machines.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An assembly plant for automobiles and other vehicles.
meanings_and_examples.example: The Ford factory on the outskirts of Detroit is known for producing a variety of cars.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A large-scale industrial building where products are manufactured or packaged.
meanings_and_examples.example: The electronics factory in Shenzhen churns out millions of gadgets each month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An establishment for the mass production of goods through machinery and labor coordination.
meanings_and_examples.example: The textile factory uses advanced looms to weave fabrics at a rapid pace.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In business jargon, referring to a company that focuses on manufacturing rather than services or software.
meanings_and_examples.example: Our investment portfolio includes shares in several industrial factories across Europe.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used metaphorically to describe an environment where repetitive and mechanistic work is performed, often lacking innovation.
meanings_and_examples.example: Many critics argue that the new policy has turned our education system into a factory of conformity.
